channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024081159
item.description:
Report X-2024081159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: Carlisle
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated when they opened the trailer they noticed 2 pails had been crushed by freight that had fallen from overhead causing roughly 2 gallons to spill onto the trailer floor and dock. ABF stated none has spilled onto the yard.

item.title: Report I-2024070092
item.description:
Report I-2024070092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: LAKE ARIEL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 132700
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver made reversed hose connections to tractor mounted product pump. This caused the pump to draft from the receiving AST and into the transport trailer, ultimately overfilling the compartment, filling the vapor system, and releasing to the ground. The compartment dome lid was forced up due to pressure releasing larger amount until pump could be stopped. Product flowed by natura gravity to a retention pond adjacent to the AST delivery area. Lewis Environmental responded for remediation of ground and affected water retention pond.

item.title: Report I-2024070091
item.description:
Report I-2024070091

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: EPHRATA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11525
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Delivery driver failed to make proper hose connection to drop fitting. Driver opened delivery valve releasing approximately 10 gallons to concrete lot. Rainwater carried product into storm sewer. Product traveled through storm sewer to Cocalico Creek (1/4 mile away). Lewis Environmental reacted with containment booms in creek to contain. Booms remained in place to absorb any residual until no further evidence of product remained.

item.title: Report X-2024080973
item.description:
Report X-2024080973

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: PITTSBURGH
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the PITR location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans separated by fiberboard dividers three of the cans had positive closure rings. One can did not have a closure ring and lid came off spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
